text: This quickstart guide to creating custom modules is quite useful, but assumes basic knowledge of working the CMS :slightly_smiling_face: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-modules>

Hi guys! Are developer courses on HubSpot still relevant to the current HubSpot environment. I am following every bit of the steps on the video tutorials and getting a different from the actual result. It's kind of frustrating to learn the development process if the videos are outdated. I'm currently taking this course "HubSpot CMS themes quickstart for developers" and can't move forward due to issues like this:

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Is-the-HubSpot-CMS-for-Developers-course-up-to-date/m-p/756917>
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Test-theme-folder-empty/m-p/820959#M35052>
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Having-error-when-upload-html-page-template-to-CMS/m-p/628089>

Anyone experiencing the same issues I am having. I'm kind of new to HubSpot development and these courses is getting me more confused.

Hey <@U02227D27V3> it seems that these developer courses are outdated. Followed step by step on the video and the video preview is totally different from the actual result. e.g. test-theme folder is empty. followed what the video is doing and can't get the same result.
